alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 26 at 5:29AM MST until January 26 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches. The heavier activity will likely impact the Interstate 25 corridor in western San Miguel County. Visibility occasionally reduced to one quarter miles or less in heavy snow. * WHERE...Eastern San Miguel County and Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes portions of I-25.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Northeast Highlands
